original_title: SriLankan Airlines flies in Indian journalists to promote tourism
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – SriLankan Airlines organized a special tour of the island for journalists from India’s mainstream print and news media to promote Sri Lanka as one of India’s premier tourist destinations.

“The journalists toured the country from November 19-24 and took the opportunity to experience Colombo’s cultural attractions, local cuisine, Sri Lanka’s beaches, nature trails, shopping and nightlife,” the government information department said in a statement.
The journalists were from metro cities of India like Cochin, Chennai, Bangalore and Delhi.
Sri Lanka has requested interest from investors to divest SriLankan Airlines, an online notice by the island’s State Owned Enterprise Unit said.
State-run SriLankan Airlines reported a 79 billion rupee profit in the first eight months of 2023, official data showed.
The carrier’s flights were disrupted recently after several aircraft were grounded on technical defects with engineering staff said to be on work to rule. (Colombo/Dec5/2023)
